subject: Data
title: Data Colonialism: When Open Data Extracts Value
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Data Colonialism: When Open Data Extracts Value.

hook.text: A tech company uses open satellite data of African farmland to build a profitable crop prediction product.

buildup.text: Data colonialism describes how wealthy organizations extract value from developing countries' open data.

discovery.text: When open data flows from poor countries to rich corporations, the 'open' label can mask a new form of extraction.

twist.text: Some developing nations now restrict data exports, arguing that open data disproportionately benefits the already powerful.

climax.text: True data equity means not just opening data, but ensuring the benefits flow back to data creators.

quiz.question: What is 'data colonialism'?
options: Wealthy entities extracting value from others' open data without fair benefit sharing
